thread.title: AIA Is an Insurer to Back in China - WSJ

author: Jacky Wong
title: AIA Is an Insurer to Back in China - WSJ
text:
While China is busy clearing up a mess in its domestic insurance sector, a Hong Kong-based insurer with American roots has become a good way to bet on the country.

AIA Group, spun out of AIG following the global financial crisis, showed a 53% surge last year in the value of its new business in mainland China, helping its after-tax operating profit jump by 18% to $4.7 billion. That China pace made even AIGâ€™s 17% growth in its home Hong Kong market look pedestrian. Put together, Hong Kong and China now account for some two-thirds...
